text:
e="preserve">Peter G. "Pat" Stark (April 8, 1930 – June 19, 2020) was an American college football player and coach. He was the head football coach at the University of Rochester from 1969 to 1983. He had a record of 69–64–3. As a quarterback at Syracuse University, Stark was drafted by the Pittsburgh Steelers in the 1954 NFL Draft. He was also a member for the Syracuse men's basketball team from 1951 to 1953. He was born in Penfield, New York.
Stark died on June 19, 2020 at the age of 90.
